TopicTitle: KSP (MAC) crash with extern USB Mouse

Articles.Content:
Hello Guys

Ive found a issue with my Gila GX Gaming Mouse.

I play with a Powerbook OSX 10.9.4 and KSP 0.24.2

When i start KSP without the extern Mouse. Everything just works fine.

When i plug in the Mouse, before, while or after booting KSP, the Programm freeze instantly, goes in windowsmode and i see the loading (MAC) ball. I then have to force KSP to stop.

If i disconect the mouse and restart KSP, then it works just fine again. But a window opens just once, asking me something about reopen its windows again and two possibilitys --- Dont reopen --- reopen. If i push reopen, KSP works fine again until i connect the mouse.

I didnt had this problem before 0.24. So i assume that its a bug. Not sure if its OSX or KSP???

Any solution? Im more a PC Gamer, so im bad in troubleshooting things in OSX... My bad... Thanks...

Cheers...
Are you sure you're using the latest drivers for the mouse?

To reemphasize KasperVld's question about the mouse drivers: a KSP crash related to a mouse is probably a driver problem. Make sure you have the most recent Gila GX driver.

If that's not the problem, please follow the guidelines in the Stock Support & Bug Reporting Guide. Here's how to find two of the harder to locate parts on a Mac:

  • Systems specs (Ã¯Â£Â¿ > About this Mac > More info)
  • Player.log (Finder: Go > Go to Folder..., then type: ~/Library/Logs/Unity/)

Also, the popup you're seeing is the standard crash dialog on Macs. It's asking whether you want to Ignore, Report, or Reopen after the crash.

Did you try just using the USB-HID drivers, instead of the specialty drivers.

The drivers that ship with USB Mice aren't really necessary, and more often than not they cause more problems than they solve.
